text.section: On or before January 1, 2014, the functions and operations of the Exchange shall include at a minimum all functions required by § 1311(d)(4) of the Affordable Care Act.

If an individual enrolls in another type of minimum essential coverage, neither the Exchange nor a carrier offering qualified health plans through the Exchange may charge the individual a fee or penalty for termination of coverage on the grounds that:
the individual has become newly eligible for that coverage; or
the individual's employer-sponsored coverage has become affordable under the standards of § 36b(c)(2)(c) of the Internal Revenue Code.

The Exchange, through the advisory committees established under § 31-106(g) of this title or through other means, shall consult with and consider the recommendations of the stakeholders represented on the advisory committees in the exercise of its duties under this title.

The Exchange may not make available:
any health benefit plan that is not a qualified health plan;
any dental plan that is not a qualified dental plan; or
any vision plan that is not a qualified vision plan.
